intro: Hiptage javanica f. rubella, commonly known as the red-flowered hiptage, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking red or pink tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. The flowers are primarily pollinated by birds, particularly sunbirds, due to their nectar-rich structure.
